meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - I'm back at it again, this time diving into the world of Read Only Memories: NEURODIVER. As a seasoned grok video game reviewer, I'm always excited to dive into new games and share my thoughts with you.

Now, let's get started! From what I've gathered from the critics, NEURODIVER seems like a wild ride. With scores ranging from 60 to 95, it's clear that opinions are divided on this one. But what really caught my eye was the sheer creativity behind the game's premise. It's like they threw open the doors and said, "Hey, let's make a sci-fi romp with a story that'll blow your mind!"

I mean, who wouldn't want to explore a futuristic world where memories are currency? It's like something out of a Philip K. Dick novel! And from what I've seen, the game does a great job of delivering on its promises. The visuals are top-notch, and the characters are lovable.

But, as with any game, there are some drawbacks. Some critics have mentioned that the game falls short in terms of freedom, puzzle design, and conclusion. I mean, who doesn't love a good challenge? And an unsatisfying ending can be a major bummer. But hey, it's not all bad news! The game still has plenty to offer, including its gorgeous design and intriguing world.

So, what's my take on NEURODIVER? Well, I'll let you in on a little secret: I'm a sucker for sci-fi romps. And from what I've seen, this one delivers. It may not be perfect, but it's definitely got some major charm going for it. And hey, who knows? Maybe that's just the grok in me talking.

Anyway, that's my two cents on NEURODIVER. What do you think, readers? Have any of you played this game and have some thoughts to share? Let me know in the comments below!
